feat.name: Aberrant Dragonmark
entries: You have manifested an aberrant dragonmark. Determine its appearance and the flaw associated with it. You gain the following benefits:

items: You learn a {@filter cantrip of your choice from the sorcerer spell list|spells|level=0|class=Sorcerer}. In addition, choose a {@filter 1st-level spell from the sorcerer spell list|spells|level=1|class=Sorcerer}. You learn that spell and can cast it through your mark. Once you cast it, you must finish a short or long rest before you can cast it again through the mark. Constitution is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

When you cast the 1st-level spell through your mark, you can expend one of your Hit Dice and roll it. If you roll an even number, you gain a number of temporary hit points equal to the number rolled. If you roll an odd number, one random creature within 30 feet of you (not including you) takes force damage equal to the number rolled. If no other creatures are in range, you take the damage.

entries: You also develop a random flaw from the Aberrant Dragonmark Flaws table.

entries.caption: Aberrant Dragonmark Flaws
rows: Your mark is a source of constant physical pain.
Your mark whispers to you. Its meaning can be unclear.
When you're stressed, the mark hisses audibly.
The skin around the mark is burned, scaly, or withered.
You have a mood swing any time you use your mark.
Your looks change slightly whenever you use the mark.
You have horrific nightmares after you use your mark.

entries.name: Option: Greater Aberrant Powers
entries: At the DM's option, a character who has the Aberrant Dragonmark feat has a chance of manifesting greater power. Upon reaching 10th level, such a character has a {@chance 10} chance of gaining an {@filter epic boon|rewards|type=boon} from among the options in chapter 7 of the {@book Dungeon Master's Guide|DMG}. If the character fails to gain a boon, they have a {@chance 10} chance the next time they gain a level.

If the character gains a boon, the DM chooses it or determines it randomly. The character also permanently loses one of their Hit Dice, and their hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to a roll of that die plus their Constitution modifier (minimum reduction of 1). This reduction can't be reversed by any means.

feat.name: Actor
entries: Skilled at mimicry and dramatics, you gain the following benefits:

entries.name: Impersonation.
entries: You have advantage on Charisma ({@skill Deception}) and Charisma ({@skill Performance}) checks when trying to pass yourself off as a different person.

entries.name: Mimicry.
entries: You can mimic the speech of another person or the sounds made by other creatures. You must have heard the person speaking, or heard the creature make the sound, for at least 1 minute. A successful Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) check contested by your Charisma ({@skill Deception}) check allows a listener to determine that the effect is faked.

feat.name: Adept of the Black Robes

feat: initiate of high sorcery|dsotdq|initiate of high sorcery (nuitari)

entries: You chose the moon Nuitari to influence your magic, and your ambition and loyalty to the Order of the Black Robes have been recognized, granting you these benefits:

items.name: Ambitious Magic
entries: You learn one 2nd-level spell of your choice. The {@filter 2nd-level spell|spells|level=2|school=E;N} must be from the enchantment or necromancy school of magic. You can cast this feat's 2nd-level spell without a spell slot, and you must finish a long rest before you can cast it in this way again. You can also cast this spell using spell slots you have of the appropriate level. The spell's spellcasting ability is the one chosen when you gained the {@feat Initiate of High Sorcery|DSotDQ} feat.

items.name: Life Channel
entries: You can channel your life force into the power of your magic. When a creature you can see within 60 feet of you fails a saving throw against a spell that deals damage that you cast, you can expend a number of Hit Dice equal to the level of the spell. Roll the expended Hit Dice and add them together. The damage that the creature takes increases by an amount equal to that total.

feat.name: Adept of the Red Robes

feat: initiate of high sorcery|dsotdq|initiate of high sorcery (lunitari)

entries: You chose the moon Lunitari to influence your magic, and your dedication to maintaining the balance between all things has been recognized by the Order of the Red Robes, granting you these benefits:

items.name: Insightful Magic
entries: You learn one 2nd-level spell of your choice. The {@filter 2nd-level spell|spells|level=2|school=I;T} must be from the illusion or transmutation school of magic. You can cast this feat's 2nd-level spell without a spell slot, and you must finish a long rest before you can cast it in this way again. You can also cast this spell using spell slots you have of the appropriate level. The spell's spellcasting ability is the one chosen when you gained the {@feat Initiate of High Sorcery|DSotDQ} feat.

items.name: Magical Balance
entries: When you make an attack roll or an ability check and roll a 9 or lower on the {@dice d20}, you can balance fate and treat the roll as a 10. You can balance fate in this way a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

feat.name: Adept of the White Robes

feat: initiate of high sorcery|dsotdq|initiate of high sorcery (solinari)

entries: You chose the moon Solinari to influence your magic, and your oath to use magic to make the world a better place has been recognized by the Order of the White Robes, granting you these benefits:

items.name: Protective Magic
entries: You learn one 2nd-level spell of your choice. The {@filter 2nd-level spell|spells|level=2|school=A;D} must be from the abjuration or divination school of magic. You can cast this feat's 2nd-level spell without a spell slot, and you must finish a long rest before you can cast it in this way again. You can also cast this spell using spell slots you have of the appropriate level. The spell's spellcasting ability is the one chosen when you gained the {@feat Initiate of High Sorcery|DSotDQ} feat.

items.name: Protective Ward
entries: When you or a creature you can see within 30 feet of you takes damage, you can use your reaction to expend a spell slot and weave protective magic around the target. Roll a number of d6s equal to the level of the spell slot expended and reduce the damage the target takes by the total rolled on those dice + your spellcasting ability modifier.

feat.name: Adroit Crafter

otherSummary.entry: Proficiency in a skill or tool

entries: You've trained in crafting items using a skill or tool that you're proficient with, and the steps in crafting have become second nature to you. You gain the following benefits:

entries.name: Quick Crafting.
entries: The time it takes to create an item using your proficient skills or tools is halved. If you fail to successfully craft the item and would lose the components, you retain the components instead.

feat.name: Adroit Crafter

otherSummary.entry: Proficiency in a skill or tool

entries: You've trained in crafting items using a skill or tool that you're proficient with, and the steps in crafting have become second nature to you. You gain the following benefits:

items: The time it takes to create an item using your proficient skills or tools is halved.
If you fail to successfully craft the item and would lose the components, you retain the components instead.

feat.name: Agent of Order

feat: scion of the outer planes|sato|scion of the outer planes (lawful outer plane)

entries: You can channel cosmic forces of order to gain these benefits:

items.name: Stasis Strike
entries: Once per turn, when you damage a creature you can see within 60 feet of yourself, you can deal an extra {@damage 1d8} force damage to the target, and it must make a Wisdom saving throw (DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + the modifier of the spellcasting ability you chose for the Scion of the Outer Planes feat) as spectral bindings try to ensnare it. On a successful save, the target escapes. On a failed save, the target has the restrained condition until the start of your next turn. These bindings manifest as chains or some other symbol of stasis. You can use this benefit a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

feat.name: Alert
entries: Always on the lookout for danger, you gain the following benefits:

entries.name: Initiative Boost.
entries: You gain a +5 bonus to your initiative roll.

entries.name: Surprise Immunity.
entries: You can't be {@status surprised} while you are conscious.

entries.name: Avert Advantage Attack Rolls.
entries: Other creatures do not gain advantage on attack rolls against you as a result of being unseen by you.

feat.name: Artificer Initiate
entries: You've learned some of an artificer's inventiveness:

entries.name: Gained Spells.
entries: You learn one cantrip of your choice from the {@filter artificer spell list|spells|level=0;1|class=artificer}, and you learn one 1st-level spell of your choice from {@filter that list|spells|level=0;1|class=artificer}. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for these spells.
You can cast this feat's 1st-level spell without a spell slot, and you must finish a long rest before you can cast it in this way again. You can also cast the spell using any spell slots you have.

entries.name: Artisan's Tool Proficiency.
entries: You gain proficiency with one type of {@filter artisan's tools|items|type=artisan's tools} of your choice, and you can use that type of tool as a spellcasting focus for any spell you cast that uses Intelligence as its spellcasting ability.

feat.name: Athlete
entries: You have undergone extensive physical training to gain the following benefits:

entries.name: Quick to Stand.
entries: When you are {@condition prone}, standing up uses only 5 feet of your movement.

entries.name: Climber.
entries: You gain a climbing speed equal to your walking speed.

entries.name: Running Jump.
entries: You can make a running long jump or a running high jump after moving only 5 feet on foot, rather than 10 feet.

feat.name: Baleful Scion

feat: scion of the outer planes|sato|scion of the outer planes (evil outer plane)

entries: You can channel cosmic forces of evil to gain these benefits:

items.name: Grasp of Avarice
entries: Once per turn, when you damage a creature you can see within 60 feet of yourself, you can also deal necrotic damage to it. The necrotic damage equals {@damage 1d6} + your proficiency bonus, and you regain a number of hit points equal to this necrotic damage dealt. You can use this benefit a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

feat.name: Bountiful Luck
entries: Your people have extraordinary luck, which you have learned to mystically lend to your companions when you see them falter. You're not sure how you do it; you just wish it, and it happens. Surely a sign of fortune's favor!

entries.name: Ally Support.
entries: When an ally you can see within 30 feet of you rolls a 1 on the {@dice d20} for an attack roll, an ability check, or a saving throw, you can use your reaction to let the ally reroll the die. The ally must use the new roll.

entries.name: Limited Luck.
entries: When you use this ability, you can't use your Lucky racial trait before the end of your next turn.

feat.name: Careful Crafter

otherSummary.entry: Proficiency with at least one tool

entries: You've trained in crafting items using a skill or tool that you're proficient with, and your creations are known for being well made and reliable. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Advantage.
entries: You make all ability checks for crafting with advantage. Anyone assisting you in crafting an item gains advantage on their ability checks for crafting.

entries.name: Quickfail.
entries: If you fail to successfully craft the item, the amount of time it took to complete the process is halved.

feat.name: Careful Crafter

otherSummary.entry: Proficiency in a skill or tool

entries: You've trained in crafting items using a skill or tool that you're proficient with, and your creations are known for being well made and reliable. You gain the following benefits:

items: You make all ability checks for crafting with advantage.
Anyone assisting you in crafting an item gains advantage on their ability checks for crafting.
If you fail to successfully craft the item, the amount of time it took to complete the process is halved.

feat.name: Cartomancer
entries: You have learned to channel your magic through a deck of cards. You can use a card deck as your spellcasting focus, and you gain the following benefits:

entries.name: Card Tricks
entries: You learn the {@spell Prestidigitation} cantrip and can use it to create illusions that duplicate the effects of stage magic. When you use {@spell Prestidigitation} in this way, you can conceal the verbal and somatic components of the spell as ordinary conversation and card handling.

entries.name: Hidden Ace
entries: When you finish a long rest, you can choose one spell from your class's spell list and imbue that spell into a card. The chosen spell must have a casting time of 1 action, and it must be a level for which you have spell slots. The card remains imbued with this spell for 8 hours. While the card is imbued with the spell, you can use a bonus action to flourish the card and cast the spell within. The card then immediately loses its magic.

feat.name: Charger
entries: Your ability to use your movement to aid your attacks grants you the following benefits.

entries.name: Dash Attack.
entries: When you take the Dash action, you can use your Bonus Action to make one of the following attacks:

items: Melee Weapon Attack
Unarmed Strike Attack
Unarmed Shove Attack

entries: If you have the Brawler Fighting Style, you can add your Unarmed Grapple Attack as an option for your Bonus Action Dash Attack.

entries.name: Charge Attack
entries: If you move at least 10 feet in a straight line toward a target immediately before before making your bonus action Dash Attack, you gain the following benefits on a hit:

items.name: Attack Roll.
entries: You gain a +5 bonus to your damage roll for a melee weapon attack or unarmed strike attack.

items.name: Contested Roll.
entries: You can shove the target up to 10 feet away if it is no more than one size larger than you with your unarmed shove attack.

feat.name: Chef
entries: Time spent mastering the culinary arts has paid off, granting you the following benefits.

entries.name: Cook's Utensils.
entries: You gain proficiency with {@item cook's utensils|phb} if you don't already have it.

entries.name: Replenishing Meal.
entries: As part of a short rest, you can cook special food, provided you have ingredients and {@item cook's utensils|phb} on hand. You can prepare enough of this food for a number of creatures equal to 4 + your proficiency bonus. At the end of the short rest, any creature who eats the food and spends one or more Hit Dice to regain hit points regains an extra {@dice 1d8} hit points.

entries.name: Bolstering Treats.
entries: With one hour of work or when you finish a long rest, you can cook a number of treats equal to your proficiency bonus. These special treats last 8 hours after being made. A creature can use a bonus action to eat one of those treats to gain temporary hit points equal to your proficiency bonus.

feat.name: Cohort of Chaos

feat: scion of the outer planes|sato|scion of the outer planes (chaotic outer plane)

entries: You can channel cosmic forces of chaos to gain these benefits:

items.name: Chaotic Flare
entries: When you roll a 1 or a 20 on an attack roll or a saving throw, the magic of chaos flows through you. Roll a d4 and consult the Chaotic Flares table to determine what happens. A flare lasts until the end of your next turn, and a new flare can't occur until after the first flare ends.

entries.caption: Chaotic Flares
rows: {@b Battle Fury.} A creature of your choice that you can see is filled with reckless fury. It has advantage on attack rolls and disadvantage on ability checks.

{@b Disruption Field.} Waves of energy ripple around you. Every creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of you, or that moves into that area for the first time on a turn, takes {@damage 1d8} force damage.

{@b Unbound.} When you move, you can use some or all of your walking speed to teleport yourself once, along with any equipment you're wearing or carrying, up to the distance used to an unoccupied space that you can see.
{@b Wailing Winds.} Winds swirl in a 15-foot-radius sphere centered on you. You and any other creatures in that area have disadvantage on Wisdom saving throws.

feat.name: Crossbow Expert
entries: You have trained extensively with the crossbow and can use it more efficiently than most. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Ignore Loading.
entries: You can ignore the loading property of all crossbows you wield as long as you have a free hand and have proficiency with the weapon. When it comes to crossbows with the Reload Property, it takes your Bonus Action, instead of your Action, to refill the entire cartridge with bolts.

entries.name: Melee-Range Ranged Attacks.
entries: Being within 5 feet of a hostile creature does not impose disadvantage on your ranged attack rolls.
If you have the Melee Marksman Fighting Style, you have advantage on ranged attack rolls against a target within 5 feet of you.

entries.name: Two-Weapon Fighting with a Hand Crossbow.
entries: When you take the Attack action and make an attack with a one-handed melee weapon, you can use a bonus action to make an attack with a hand crossbow in your off-hand.

feat.name: Cruel
entries: The challenges and struggles you've faced throughout your life have led you to delight in inflicting pain and anguish upon others, gaining the following benefits.

entries.name: Curelty Dice.
entries: You gain a number of cruelty dice equal to your proficiency bonus. Your cruelty dice are {@dice d6|d6s}. You can roll only one cruelty die per turn, and a cruelty die is spent when you roll it. You regain all spent cruelty dice when you finish a {@quickref resting|PHB|2|0|long rest}.

entries.name: Dice Use.
entries: You can roll a cruelty die under any of the following circumstances, with the indicated result:

items.name: Cruel Damage.
entries: When you deal damage to a creature, spend one cruelty die to deal extra damage to the creature equal to the roll.

items.name: Cruel Critical
entries: When you score a critical hit, spend one cruelty die to gain temporary hit points equal to the roll.

items.name: Cruel Indimidator
entries: When you make a Charisma ({@skill Intimidation}) check, spend one cruelty die and add the roll to your check.

feat.name: Cruel
entries: The challenges and struggles you've faced throughout your life have led you to delight in inflicting pain and anguish upon others. You gain a number of cruelty dice equal to your proficiency bonus. Your cruelty dice are {@dice d6|d6s}. You can roll only one cruelty die per turn, and a cruelty die is spent when you roll it.
You can roll a cruelty die under any of the following circumstances, with the indicated result:

items: When you deal damage to a creature, spend one cruelty die to deal extra damage to the creature equal to the roll.
When you score a critical hit, spend one cruelty die to gain temporary hit points equal to the roll.
When you make a Charisma ({@skill Intimidation}) check, spend one cruelty die and add the roll to your check.

entries: You regain all spent cruelty dice when you finish a {@quickref resting|PHB|2|0|long rest}.

feat.name: Crusher
entries: You are practiced in the art of crushing your enemies through bludgeoning damage, granting you the following benefits.

entries.name: Hit & Push.
entries: Once per turn, when you hit a creature with an attack that deals bludgeoning damage, such as a melee weapon or with an unarmed strike attack, you can move it 5 feet to an unoccupied space of your choice away from you, provided the target is no more than one size larger than you.

entries.name: Enhanced Critical.
entries: When you score a critical hit that deals bludgeoning damage to a creature, attack rolls against that creature are made with advantage until the start of your next turn.

feat.name: Defensive Duelist
entries: You are skilled in dueling and responding to attacks. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Reactive Defense.
entries: When a creature you can see hits you with a melee attack while you are wielding a Finesse or Light melee weapon you are proficient with, you can use your reaction to add your Proficiency Bonus to your Armor Class against that attack, potentially causing a miss. This bonus lasts until the start of your next turn against melee weapon attacks.
When you use this reaction and the attack misses, you can make a single melee weapon attack against your attacker as part of the same reaction.

feat.name: Divinely Favored
entries: A god chose you to carry a spark of their power.

You learn one cantrip of your choice from the {@filter cleric spell list|spells|level=0|class=cleric} and one 1st-level spell based on the alignment of your character, as specified in the Alignment Spells table below. You also learn the {@spell augury} spell.

You can cast the chosen 1st-level spell and the {@spell augury} spell without a spell slot, and you must finish a long rest before you can cast either of these spells in this way again. You can also cast these spells using spell slots you have of the appropriate level.
Your spellcasting ability for this feat's spells is Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma (choose when you select this feat).
In addition, you can use a holy symbol as a spellcasting focus for any spell you cast that uses the spellcasting ability you choose when you select this feat.

feat.name: Dragon Fear
entries: When angered, you radiate menace. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Frighten Foes.
entries: Instead of exhaling destructive energy, you can expend a use of your Breath Weapon trait to roar, forcing each creature of your choice within 30 feet of you to make a Wisdom saving throw ({@dc 8} + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier). A target automatically succeeds on the save if it can't hear or see you. On a failed save, a target becomes {@condition frightened} of you for 1 minute. If the {@condition frightened} target takes any damage, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

feat.name: Dragon Hide
entries: You manifest scales and claws reminiscent of your draconic ancestors. You gain the following benefits:

entries.name: Dragon Armor.
entries: Your scales harden. While you aren't wearing armor, you can calculate your AC as 13 + your Dexterity modifier. You can use a shield and still gain this benefit.

entries.name: Natural Weapons.
entries: You grow retractable claws from the tips of your fingers. Extending or retracting the claws requires no action. The claws are natural weapons, which you can use to make Unarmed Strike Attacks. If you hit with them, you deal slashing damage instead of the normal bludgeoning damage for an unarmed strike attack.
Additionally, if your claws are extended when you make an Unarmed Shove Attack, the target takes half damage from your Unarmed Strike Attack when they fail the check in addition to being shoved.

feat.name: Drow High Magic
entries: You learn additional magic utilized by your lineage, gaining the following benefits.

entries.name: Bonus Spells.
entries: You learn the {@spell detect magic} spell and can cast it at will, without expending a spell slot. You also learn {@spell levitate} and {@spell dispel magic}, each of which you can cast once without expending a spell slot. You regain the ability to cast those two spells in this way when you finish a long rest. Your spellcasting ability is the one you use to cast your other Drow spells.

feat.name: Dungeon Delver
entries: You are as skilled as one can be at exploring dungeons and disarming deadly traps, bringing these skills to all environments you explore. You gain the benefits listed below.

entries.name: Skills and Toolset.
entries: You have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) and Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) checks made to detect the presence of secret doors and traps. You also gain proficiency in {@item Thieves’ Tools}, if you don’t already have it.

entries.name: Advantage and Resistance.
entries: You have advantage on saving throws to avoid or resist traps and are resistant to the damage dealt by traps.

entries.name: Fast Travel.
entries: Traveling at a fast pace does not impose the normal -5 penalty on your passive Investigation and Perception scores.

feat.name: Durable
entries: Hardy and resilient, you gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Hit Points Regained.
entries: When you roll a Hit Die to regain hit points, the minimum number of hit points you regain from the roll equals twice your Constitution modifier (minimum of 2).

entries.name: Defy Death.
entries: You have Advantage on Death Saving Throws.

entries.name: Speedy Recovery
entries: As a Bonus Action, you can expend and roll one of your Hit Dice to regain hit points.

feat.name: Dwarven Fortitude
entries: You have the blood of dwarf heroes flowing through your veins. You gain the following benefits:

entries.name: Dodge to Heal.
entries: Whenever you take the {@action Dodge} action in combat, you can spend one Hit Die to heal yourself. Roll the die, add your Constitution modifier, and regain a number of hit points equal to the total (minimum of 1).

feat.name: Eldritch Adept
entries: Studying occult lore, you gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Invocation.
entries: You learn one {@filter Eldritch Invocation|optionalfeatures|Feature Type=EI} option of your choice from the warlock class. The invocation's spellcasting ability is the abiity increased by this feat. If the invocation has a prerequisite of any kind, you can choose that invocation only if you're a warlock who meets the prerequisite.

entries.name: Optional Replacement.
entries: Whenever you gain a level, you can replace the invocation with another one from the warlock class.

feat.name: Elemental Adept
entries: You become adept at utilizing elements in your magic. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Energy Mastery.
entries: Choose one of the following damage types: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder. Spells you cast ignore resistance to damage of the chosen type. In addition, when you roll damage for a spell you cast that deals damage of that type, you can treat any 1 on a damage die as a 2.

entries.name: Repeatable.
entries: You can take this feat more than once, but you must choose a different damage type each time from the Energy Mastery benefit.

feat.name: Elven Accuracy
entries: The accuracy of elves is legendary, especially that of elf archers and spellcasters. You have uncanny aim with attacks that rely on precision rather than brute force. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Reroll Advantage.
entries: Whenever you have advantage on an attack roll using Dexterity, Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma, you can reroll one of the dice once.

feat.name: Ember of the Fire Giant

feat: strike of the giants|BGG|strike of the giants (fire strike)

entries: You've manifested the fiery combat emblematic of fire giants, granting you the following benefits:

items.name: Born of Flame
entries: You have resistance to fire damage.

items.name: Searing Ignition
entries: When you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn, you can replace a single attack with a magical burst of flame. Each creature of your choice in a 15-foot-radius sphere centered on you must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + the modifier of the ability increased by this feat). On a failed save, a creature takes fire damage equal to {@damage 1d8} + your proficiency bonus, and it has the blinded condition until the start of your next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage only. You can use your Searing Ignition a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus (but no more than once per turn), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

feat.name: Exploit Training
entries: You have studied the use of exploits from a specific source. When you choose this feat, choose 1 of the following categories below to gain two 1st-Degree Exploits from and you gain the following benefits.

items: {@filter Devious Exploits (Rogue Class)|optionalfeatures|feature type=ll:1de;ll:me=sand}
{@filter Martial Exploits (Fighter Class)|optionalfeatures|feature type=ll:1de;ll:me=sand}
{@filter Savage Exploits (Barbarian Class)|optionalfeatures|feature type=ll:1de;ll:me=sand}

entries: If an Exploit you use requires the target to make a saving throw to resist the effects, the DC is equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice).

entries.name: Exploit Dice.
entries: You gain two d4 exploit dice. When you use your exploit, you expend the use of 1 of those dice, regaining all expended uses on a short or long rest, however if you already have Exploit Dice from another source, you only gain 1 exploit die at the die size you currently have.

entries.name: Repeatable and Replaceable.
entries: You can choose this feat again at higher levels, choosing a different category of exploits to choose from. Additionally, when you gain a level, you can choose to replace one 1st-Degree exploit with another 1st-Degree Exploit from the same category.

feat.name: Fade Away
entries: Your people are clever, with a knack for illusion magic. You have learned a magical trick for fading away when you suffer harm. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Invisible Reaction.
entries: Immediately after you take damage, you can use a reaction to magically become {@condition invisible} until the end of your next turn or until you attack, deal damage, or force someone to make a saving throw. Once you use this ability, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

feat.name: Fey Teleportation
entries: Your study of high elven lore has unlocked fey power that few other elves possess, except your eladrin cousins. Drawing on your fey ancestry, you can momentarily stride through the Feywild to shorten your path from one place to another. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Sylvan.
entries: You learn to speak, read, and write {@language Sylvan}.

entries.name: Misty Step.
entries: You learn the {@spell misty step} spell and can cast it once without expending a spell slot. You regain the ability to cast it in this way when you finish a short or long rest. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

feat.name: Fey Touched
entries: Your exposure to the Feywild's magic has changed you, granting you the following benefits:

entries.name: Fey Magic.
entries: You learn the {@spell misty step} spell and one {@filter 1st-level spell|spells|level=1|school=E;D} of your choice. The {@filter 1st-level spell|spells|level=1|school=E;D} must be from the divination or enchantment school of magic. You can cast each of these spells without expending a spell slot. Once you cast either of these spells in this way, you can't cast that spell in this way again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast these spells using spell slots you have of the appropriate level. The spells' spellcasting ability is the ability increased by this feat or your own if you already have one.

feat.name: Fighting Initiate
entries: Your martial training has helped you develop a particular style of fighting, granting you the following benefits.

entries.name: Fighting Style.
entries: You learn one {@filter Fighting Style|optionalfeatures|Feature Type=FS:F} option of your choice from the fighter class. If you already have a style, the one you choose must be different.
Whenever you reach a level that grants the Ability Score Improvement feature, you can replace this feat's fighting style with another one from the fighter class that you don't have.

feat.name: Flames of Phlegethos
entries: You learn to call on hellfire to serve your commands. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Reroll Fire Damage.
entries: When you roll fire damage for a spell you cast, you can reroll any roll of 1 on the fire damage dice, but you must use the new roll, even if it is another 1.

entries.name: Fire Aura.
entries: Whenever you cast a spell that deals fire damage, you can cause flames to wreathe you until the end of your next turn. The flames don't harm you or your possessions, and they shed bright light out to 30 feet and dim light for an additional 30 feet. While the flames are present, any creature within 5 feet of you that hits you with a melee attack takes {@damage 1d4} fire damage.

feat.name: Flash Recall
entries: You've developed the ability to instantly recall an unprepared spell in moments of sudden necessity, gaining the following benefits.

entries.name: Bonus Action Re-Prepare.
entries: As a bonus action, you prepare a spell of 1st level or higher from your spellbook (if you're a {@class wizard}) or from your class spell list (if you're not a {@class wizard}). This spell must be of a level for which you have spell slots, and it replaces another spell of an equal or higher level that you had previously prepared.
Once you use this feat to recall a spell, you can't do so again until you complete a {@quickref resting|PHB|2|0|short or long rest}.

entries.name: Rules Tip: Prepared Spells
entries: The Flash Recall feat requires you to be a spellcaster who prepares spells. This includes classes such as {@class cleric||clerics}, {@class druid||druids}, and {@class rangers||rangers}, who prepare spells each day from their class list, and {@class wizard||wizards}, who prepare spells from a spellbook. Classes such as {@class bard||bards} and {@class sorcerer||sorcerers}, who inherently know their spells rather than preparing them, can't benefit from this feat.

feat.name: Flash Recall
entries: You've developed the ability to instantly recall an unprepared spell in moments of sudden necessity.

As a bonus action, you prepare a spell of 1st level or higher from your spellbook (if you're a {@class wizard}) or from your class spell list (if you're not a {@class wizard}). This spell must be of a level for which you have spell slots, and it replaces another spell of an equal or higher level that you had previously prepared.
Once you use this feat to recall a spell, you can't do so again until you complete a {@quickref resting|PHB|2|0|short or long rest}.

entries.name: Rules Tip: Prepared Spells
entries: The Flash Recall feat requires you to be a spellcaster who prepares spells. This includes classes such as {@class cleric||clerics}, {@class druid||druids}, and {@class paladin||paladins}, who prepare spells each day from their class list, and {@class wizard||wizards}, who prepare spells from a spellbook. Classes such as {@class bard||bards} and {@class sorcerer||sorcerers}, who inherently know their spells rather than preparing them, can't benefit from this feat.

feat.name: Fury of the Frost Giant

feat: strike of the giants|BGG|strike of the giants (frost strike)

entries: You've manifested the icy might emblematic of frost giants, granting you the following benefits:

items.name: Born of Ice
entries: You have resistance to cold damage.

items.name: Frigid Retaliation
entries: Immediately after a creature you can see within 30 feet of you hits you with an attack roll and deals damage, you can use your reaction to retaliate with a conjured blast of ice. The creature must make a Constitution saving throw (DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + the modifier of the ability increased by this feat). On a failed save, the creature takes cold damage equal to {@damage 1d8} + your proficiency bonus, and its speed is reduced to 0 until the end of its next turn. You can use this reaction a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

feat.name: Gift of the Chromatic Dragon
entries: You've manifested some of the power of chromatic dragons, granting you the following benefits.

entries.name: Chromatic Infusion
entries: As a bonus action, you can touch a {@filter simple or martial weapon|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=martial weapon;simple weapon} and infuse it with one of the following damage types: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison. For the next minute, the weapon deals an extra {@damage 1d4} damage of the chosen type when it hits. After you use this bonus action, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Reactive Resistance
entries: When you take acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison damage, you can use your reaction to give yourself resistance to that instance of damage. You can use this reaction a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

feat.name: Gift of the Gem Dragon
entries: You've manifested some of the power of gem dragons, granting you the following benefits.

entries.name: Crystaline Mage Hand.
entries: You can cast the Mage Hand cantrip, using the ability you increased with this feat as your spellcasting ability.

entries.name: Telekinetic Reprisal
entries: When you take damage from a creature that is within 10 feet of you, you can use your reaction to emanate telekinetic energy. The creature that dealt damage to you must make a Strength saving throw (DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + the ability modifier of the score increased by this feat). On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 2d8} force damage and is pushed up to 10 feet away from you. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't pushed. You can use this reaction a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

feat.name: Gift of the Metallic Dragon
entries: You've manifested some of the power of metallic dragons, granting you the following benefits.

entries.name: Draconic Healing
entries: You learn the {@spell cure wounds} spell. You can cast this spell without expending a spell slot. Once you cast this spell in this way, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast this spell using spell slots you have. The spell's spellcasting ability is Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma when you cast it with this feat (choose when you gain the feat).

entries.name: Protective Wings
entries: You can manifest protective wings that can shield you or others. When you or another creature you can see within 5 feet of you is hit by an attack roll, you can use your reaction to manifest spectral wings from your back for a moment. You grant a bonus to the target's AC equal to your proficiency bonus against that attack roll, potentially causing it to miss. You can use this reaction a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

feat.name: Grappler
entries: You've developed the skills necessary to hold your own in close-quarters grappling, gaining the following benefits.

entries.name: Punch and Grab.
entries: When you hit a creature with an {@action Unarmed Attack} action on your turn, you can use both the Strike and the Grapple option as part of the same attack action. You can use this benefit only once per turn.
If you have the Brawler Fighting Style, you can use your Bonus Action to make one Unarmed Strike Attack against your Punch & Grab target.

entries.name: Fast Wrestler.
entries: You don't have to spend extra movement to move a creature {@condition Grappled|XPHB} by you if the creature is your size or smaller.

feat.name: Great Weapon Master
entries: You've learned to put the weight of a weapon to your advantage, letting its momentum empower your strikes. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Bonus Attack.
entries: Immediately after you score a Critical Hit or reduce a creature to 0 Hit Points on your turn using a Heavy or Two-Handed Melee weapon, you can make one attack with the same weapon as a Bonus Action.

entries.name: Proficient Damage Dealer.
entries: You add your proficiency bonus to your damage rolls for Heavy melee weapons and Two-Handed melee weapons.
If you have the Great Weapon Master Fighting Style, you gain the above benefits for any melee weapon that does not have the Light or Finesse property.

feat.name: Guile of the Cloud Giant

feat: strike of the giants|BGG|strike of the giants (cloud strike)

entries: You've manifested the confounding magic emblematic of cloud giants, granting you the following benefits:

items.name: Cloudy Escape
entries: When a creature you can see hits you with an attack roll, you can use your reaction to give yourself resistance to that attack's damage. You then teleport to an unoccupied space that you can see within 30 feet of yourself. You can use this reaction a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

feat.name: Gunner
entries: You have a quick hand and keen eye when employing firearms, granting you the following benefits.

entries.name: Firearm Proficiency.
entries: You gain proficiency with firearms (see "{@variantrule Firearms|DMG}" in the Dungeon Master's Guide).

entries.name: Quickshot.
entries: You ignore the loading property of firearms.

entries.name: Ranged Melee Attacks.
entries: Choose 1 firearm weapon. Being within 5 feet of a hostile creature doesn't impose disadvantage on your ranged attack rolls with that selected firearm. When you reach a higher level that grants you the Ability Score Increase or Feat feature, this benefit extends to all firearms.
If you have the {@optionalfeatures Melee Marksman} Fighting Style, you make this roll with advantage.

feat.name: Hardy Physique
entries: You have hardened your physical body to absorb hits rather than dodge them, granting you the following benefits.

entries.name: AC Recalculation.
entries: You can use your Constitution, in place of Dexterity, when calculating your Armor Class in armor.

entries.name: Advantage on Saving Throws.
entries: You also have advantage on saving throws to avoid being moved against your will, Grappled, or knocked Prone.

feat.name: Healer
entries: You are an able physician, allowing you to mend wounds quickly and get your allies back in the fight. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Battle Medic
entries: If you have a {@item healer's kit|phb}, you can expend one use of it and tend to a creature within 5 feet of yourself as a action. That creature can expend one of its Hit Dice to regain a number of Hit Points equal to the roll plus your Proficiency Bonus. Additionally, if the Hit Die rolls a 1, the creature can reroll the die but must use the new roll.

entries.name: Stabilizing Bonus.
entries: When you use a {@item healer's kit|phb} to stabilize a creature with 0 hit points, the creature regains a number of hit points equal to your proficiency bonus.

feat.name: Heavily Armored
entries: You have trained to master the use of heavy armor, gaining the following benefits.

items: You now have Heavy Armor Training.

feat.name: Heavy Armor Master
entries: You can use your armor to deflect strikes that would kill others. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Damage Reduction.
entries: When you're hit by an attack while you're wearing Heavy armor, any Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage dealt to you by that attack is reduced by an amount equal to your Proficiency Bonus.

feat.name: Helpful Insights
entries: You always seem to have helpful advice for any situation. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Providing Help.
entries: You can take the {@action Help} action as a bonus action on each of your turns. Additionally, when you use a Help action to give advantage on an ability check with a skill or tool you are proficient in, the target can treat a result of 7 or lower on the {@dice d20} as an 8. This excludes Nat 1s.

feat.name: High Wood Elf Magic
entries: You learn additional magic of the primeval woods, which are revered and protected by your people. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Additional Spells.
entries: You learn one druid cantrip of your choice. You also learn the {@spell longstrider} and {@spell pass without trace} spells, each of which you can cast once without expending a spell slot. You regain the ability to cast these two spells in this way when you finish a long rest. Your spellcasting ability is the one you use to cast your other Wood Elf spells.

feat.name: Infernal Constitution
entries: Fiendish blood runs strong in you, unlocking a resilience akin to that possessed by some fiends. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Damage Resistance.
entries: You have resistance to cold and poison damage.

entries.name: Saving Throws.
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against being poisoned.

feat.name: Initiate of High Sorcery
entries: You've received training from magic-users affiliated with the Mages of High Sorcery.

Choose one of the three moons of Krynn to influence your magic: the black moon, Nuitari; the red moon, Lunitari; or the white moon, Solinari. You learn one cantrip of your choice from the wizard spell list and two 1st-level spells based on the moon you choose, as specified in the Lunar Spells table.

entries.caption: Lunar Spells
rows: Choose two from {@spell dissonant whispers}, {@spell false life}, {@spell hex}, and {@spell ray of sickness}
Choose two from {@spell color spray}, {@spell disguise self}, {@spell feather fall}, and {@spell longstrider}
Choose two from {@spell comprehend languages}, {@spell detect evil and good}, {@spell protection from evil and good}, and {@spell shield}

entries: You can cast each of the chosen 1st-level spells without a spell slot, and you must finish a long rest before you can cast them in this way again. You can also cast the spells using any spell slots you have.
Your spellcasting ability for this feat's spells is Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma (choose when you select this feat).

feat.name: Inspiring Leader
entries: You spend time inspiring your companions, shoring up their resolve to fight. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Bolstering Performance.
entries: When you finish a Short or Long Rest, you can give an inspiring performance: a speech, song, or dance. When you do so, choose up to six allies (which can include yourself) within 30 feet of yourself. The chosen creatures each gain Temporary Hit Points equal to your character level plus the modifier of the ability you increased with this feat. The Temp Hit Points last until their next short or long rest.

feat.name: Intimidating Leader
entries: You use fear and intimidation to rally those who follow you into battle. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Fearsome Rally
entry: When another creature within 30 feet of you that can also see or hear you fails a saving throw to resist the {@condition Charmed} or {@condition Frightened} condition, you can use a reaction to make a Charisma({@skill Intimidation}) check against the same save DC. On a success, the creature is not Charmed or Frightened. You can use this reaction a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus, and you regain all expended uses of this feature each time you finish a long rest.

feat.name: Inventive Adept
entries: You have spent many days tinkering with various inventions, tool sets, and arcane forces. You gain the following benefit.

entries.name: Tinker's Tools.
entries: You gain proficiency with [@item Tinker's Tools]. If you are already proficienct, you gain expertise with the toolset.

entries.name: Infusions.
entries: You learn a number of Infusions equal to your proficiency bonus available to the Artificer Class. In between long rests, you can infuse a number of items equal to half of your proficiency bonus, round down. Your infusion remains in an item indefinitely, but when you die, the infusion vanishes immediately. The infusion also vanishes immediately if you give up your knowledge of the infusion for another one when you increase your player level. Additionally, if the infusion requires attunement, you are able to instantly attune yourself to the item when you infuse it.
Please note that infusions with a listed level prerequisite are not available to gain through this feat as the level is related to your Artificer level.

feat.name: Keen Mind
entries: Your mind is a wonderful thing, capable of bursts of insight and mental fortitude. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Lore Knowledge.
entries: Choose one of the following skills: {@skill Arcana}, {@skill History}, {@skill Investigation}, {@skill Medicine}, {@skill Nature}, or {@skill Religion}. If you lack proficiency in the chosen skill, you gain proficiency in it. If you already have proficiency in the chosen skill, you gain Expertise in it.

entries.name: Environmental Knowledge.
entries: You always know which way is north and always know the number of hours left before the next sunrise or sunset.

feat.name: Keenness of the Stone Giant

feat: strike of the giants|BGG|strike of the giants (stone strike)

entries: You've manifested the physical talents emblematic of stone giants, granting you the following benefits:

items.name: Cavernous Sight
entries: You gain {@sense darkvision} with a range of 60 feet. If you already have {@sense darkvision} from another source, its range increases by 60 feet.

items.name: Stone Throw
entries: As a bonus action, you can take a rock and make a magical attack with it. The attack is a ranged spell attack with a range of 60 feet that uses the ability score you increased with this feat as the spellcasting ability. On a hit, the rock deals {@damage 1d10} force damage, and the target must succeed on a Strength saving throw (DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + the spellcasting ability modifier) or have the prone condition. You can use this bonus action a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

feat.name: Knight of the Crown
entries: You are a Knight of Solamnia aligned with the Order of the Crown, a group that extols the virtues of cooperation, loyalty, and obedience. You excel in group combat and gain these benefits:

items.name: Commanding Rally
entries: As a bonus action, you can command one ally within 30 feet of yourself to attack. If that ally can see or hear you, they can immediately make one weapon attack as a reaction. If the attack hits, the ally can roll a {@dice d8} and add the number rolled as a bonus to the attack's damage roll. You can use this bonus action a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Membership in Knightly Orders
entries: Knights of Solamnia are only ever members of one of their organization's orders. In the course of their training, most knights begin as members of the Knights of the Crown and then move on to join other orders. Whether a character follows this path or another, they retain what they learned as a member of an order even if they join another. Characters can change what knightly order they're a part of, but they always have access to any Knight of Solamnia feats they've acquired.

feat.name: Knight of the Rose
entries: You are a Knight of Solamnia aligned with the Order of the Rose, a group known for leadership, justice, and wisdom. Your resolve grants you these benefits:

items.name: Bolstering Rally
entries: As a bonus action, you can encourage one creature you can see within 30 feet of yourself (you can choose yourself). If the target can see or hear you, the target gains temporary hit points equal to {@dice 1d8} + your proficiency bonus + the ability modifier of the ability score increased by this feat. You can use this bonus action a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Membership in Knightly Orders
entries: Knights of Solamnia are only ever members of one of their organization's orders. In the course of their training, most knights begin as members of the Knights of the Crown and then move on to join other orders. Whether a character follows this path or another, they retain what they learned as a member of an order even if they join another. Characters can change what knightly order they're a part of, but they always have access to any Knight of Solamnia feats they've acquired.

feat.name: Knight of the Sword
entries: You are a Knight of Solamnia aligned with the Order of the Sword, a group devoted to heroism and courage. Bravery steels your spirit, granting you these benefits:

items.name: Demoralizing Strike
entries: Once per turn, when you hit a creature with a weapon attack roll, you can attempt to frighten that target. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw (DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + the ability modifier of the score increased by this feat). On a failed save, the target is {@condition frightened} of you until the end of your next turn. On a successful save, the target has disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes before the end of its next turn. You can use this benefit a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Membership in Knightly Orders
entries: Knights of Solamnia are only ever members of one of their organization's orders. In the course of their training, most knights begin as members of the Knights of the Crown and then move on to join other orders. Whether a character follows this path or another, they retain what they learned as a member of an order even if they join another. Characters can change what knightly order they're a part of, but they always have access to any Knight of Solamnia feats they've acquired.

feat.name: Lightly Armored
entries: You have trained to master the use of light armor, gaining the following benefits.

entries.name: Light Armor Training.
entries: You now have Light Armor Training.

feat.name: Linguist
entries: You have studied languages and codes, gaining the following benefits.

entries.name: Language Proficiency.
entries: You learn three languages of your choice.

entries.name: Creating Ciphers.
entries: You can ably create written ciphers. Others can't decipher a code you create unless you teach them, they succeed on an Intelligence check (DC equal to your Intelligence score + your proficiency bonus), or they use magic to decipher it.

feat.name: Lucky
entries: You have inexplicable luck that seems to kick in at just the right moment, gaining the following benefits.

entries.name: Luck Points.
entries: You have a number of Luck Points equal to your Proficiency Bonus and can spend the points on the benefits below. You can choose to spend one of your luck points after you roll the die, but before the outcome is determined. You regain your expended Luck Points when you finish a Long Rest. If more than one creature spends a luck point to influence the outcome of a roll, the points cancel each other out; no additional dice are rolled.

items.name: Advantage.
entries: When you roll a {@dice d20} for a D20 Test, you can spend 1 Luck Point to give yourself Advantage on the roll. A D20 Test is any roll that requires a {@dice d20} die, such as an attack roll, skill check, or saving throw.

items.name: Disadvantage.
entries: When a creature rolls a {@dice d20} for an attack roll against you, you can spend 1 Luck Point to impose Disadvantage on that roll.

feat.name: Mage Slayer

otherSummary.entry: Proficiency in at least 1 martial weapon

entries: You have trained extensively to counter sinister spellcasters and foil their arcane abilities. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Opportunity Attacks.
entries: When a creature within 5 feet of you casts a spell, you can use your reaction to make one weapon attack against it. On a hit, the creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw as if it were doing so to maintain concentration. On a failed save, its spell fails to take effect, and its slot or use of that feature/trait is still expended.

entries.name: Impact Concentration.
entries: If you damage a creature {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell, it has disadvantage on its Constitution saving throw to maintain {@status concentration}. This benefit only targets spellcasters who are already maintaining concentration on an active spell and does not stack with the above Opportunity Attacks benefit.

entries.name: Guarded Advantage.
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against spells cast by creatures you can see or hear. If you still fail with advantage on an Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma saving throw, you can use your reaction to choose to succeed once per long rest.

prerequisite.name: Magic Initiate
entries: You have been touched by magic, granting you the following benefits.

entries.name: Gained Spells.
entries: Choose a class: {@filter bard|spells|level=0;1|class=bard}, {@filter cleric|spells|level=0;1|class=cleric}, {@filter druid|spells|level=0;1|class=druid}, {@filter sorcerer|spells|level=0;1|class=sorcerer}, {@filter warlock|spells|level=0;1|class=warlock}, or {@filter wizard|spells|level=0;1|class=wizard}. You learn two cantrips of your choice from that class's spell list. In addition, choose one 1st-level spell to learn from that same list. Using this feat, you can cast the spell once at its lowest level, and you must finish a long rest before you can cast it in this way again.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability.
entries: Your spellcasting ability for these spells depends on the class you chose: Charisma for {@filter bard|spells|level=0;1|class=bard}, {@filter sorcerer|spells|level=0;1|class=sorcerer}, or {@filter warlock|spells|level=0;1|class=warlock}; Wisdom for {@filter cleric|spells|level=0;1|class=cleric} or {@filter druid|spells|level=0;1|class=druid}; or Intelligence for {@filter wizard|spells|level=0;1|class=wizard}.

prerequisite.name: Martial Arts Initiate
entries: You have some basic martial arts training, giving you some skill in both unarmed combat and unarmed defense.

entries.name: Unarmored.
entries: When you are not wearing any armor or wielding a shield, your Armor Class equals 13 + your Dexterity modifier.

entries.name: Unarmed Strikes.
entries: Your unarmed strike attacks deal bludgeoning damage equal to {@dice 1d6} + your Strength or Dexterity modifier on a hit (your choice).

entries.name: Bonus Attack.
entries: When you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn and only make Unarmed Strike Attacks, you can make a single unarmed strike attack as a bonus action on that same turn.

prerequisite.name: Medium Armor Master
entries: You have practiced moving in medium armor to gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Stealthy.
entries: Wearing medium armor doesn't impose disadvantage on your Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks.

entries.name: Dexterous Armor.
entries: When you wear medium armor, you can add 3, rather than 2, to your AC if you have a Dexterity of 16 or higher.

prerequisite.name: Metamagic Adept
entries: You have practiced and learned to manipulate your magic in unique ways. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Metamagic.
entries: You learn one {@filter Metamagic|optionalfeatures|Feature Type=MM} of your choice from those available to the Sorcerer class. You can use this Metamagic once per short or long rest, without using or expending. If you already have access to Sorcery Points, you can use those with the Metamagic gained from this feat.
Whenever you reach a level that grants the Ability Score Improvement feature, you can replace one of these Metamagic options with another one from the sorcerer class.

prerequisite.name: Mobile
entries: You are exceptionally speedy and agile. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Speed Increase
entries: Your Speed increases by 10 feet.

entries.name: Dash over Difficult Terrain
entries: When you take the {@action Dash|PHB} action on your turn, Difficult Terrain doesn't cost you extra movement for the rest of that turn.

entries.name: Agile Movement
entries: Opportunity Attacks have Disadvantage against you.

prerequisite.name: Moderately Armored
entries: You have trained to master the use of medium armor and shields, gaining the following benefits.

entries.name: Medium Armor Training.
entries: You now have Medium Armor Training and Shield Training.

prerequisite.name: Mounted Combatant
entries: You are a dangerous foe to face while {@book mounted|PHB|9|Mounted Combat}, gaining a bonus to an ability score listed below. Additionally, while you are mounted and aren't incapacitated, you gain the remaining benefits.

entries.name: Mounted Strike and Veer.
entries: You have advantage on melee attack rolls against any unmounted creature that is smaller than your mount. Additionally, you can force an attack targeted at your mount to target you instead.

entries.name: Mounted Evasion.
entries: If your mount is subjected to an effect that forces it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

entries.name: Animal Handling Bonus.
entries: If you are proficient in the {@skill Animal Handling} Skill, you can also command your mount to take any action, including actions on your mount’s Stat Block.

prerequisite.name: Musician
entries: You learn the ways of the Bard and can inspire through music. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Instrument Training
entries: You gain proficiency with three Musical Instruments of your choice.

entries.name: Encouraging Song
entries: The first time you play your musical instrument for 10 minutes after a short or long rest, you can give inspiration to allies who hear the song or watch you perform. The number of allies you can affect in this way equals your Proficiency Bonus.

prerequisite.name: Mystic Conflux
entries: You possess an intuitive understanding of the way magic ebbs and flows within enchanted items. Such items attune easily to you, and you are able to sound out their secrets. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Increased Attunement.
entries: You can attune to up to four magic items at once.

entries.name: Bold Italics statement.
entries: You can cast the {@spell identify} spell without expending a spell slot or material components. You must finish a {@quickref resting|PHB|2|0|long rest} before you can do so again.

prerequisite.name: Mystic Conflux
entries: You possess an intuitive understanding of the way magic ebbs and flows within enchanted items. Such items attune easily to you, and you are able to sound out their secrets. You gain the following benefits:

items: You can attune to up to four magic items at once.
You can cast the {@spell identify} spell without expending a spell slot or material components. You must finish a {@quickref resting|PHB|2|0|long rest} before you can do so again.

prerequisite.name: Observant
entries: Quick to notice details of your environment, you gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Lip Reading.
entries: If you can see a creature's mouth while it is speaking a language you understand, you can interpret what it's saying by reading its lips.

entries.name: Keen Observer.
entries: Choose two of the following skills to gain a +5 bonus to their passive scores: {@skill Insight}, {@skill Investigation}, or {@skill Perception}.

prerequisite.name: Orcish Fury
entries: Your fury burns tirelessly. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Heavy Hitter.
entries: When you hit with an attack using a {@filter simple or martial weapon|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=martial weapon;simple weapon}, you can roll one of the weapon's damage dice an additional time and add it as extra damage of the weapon's damage type. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Enhanced Relentless Endurance.
entries: Immediately after you use your Relentless Endurance trait, you can use your reaction to make one weapon attack.

prerequisite.name: Outlands Envoy

feat: scion of the outer planes|sato|scion of the outer planes (the outlands)

entries: You have spent significant time in Sigil or the Outlands, the crossroads of the multiverse. Being steeped in converging planar energies grants you these benefits:

items.name: Crossroads Emissary
entries: You learn the {@spell misty step} and {@spell tongues} spells. You can cast each spell once using this feat without a spell slot, and you must finish a long rest before you can cast that spell in this way again. When you cast {@spell tongues} using this feat, you require no material components. You can also cast these spells using spell slots you have of the appropriate level. The spells' spellcasting ability is the one chosen when you gained the Scion of the Outer Planes feat.

prerequisite.name: Piercer
entries: You have achieved a penetrating precision in combat, granting you the following benefits.

entries.name: Puncture.
entries: Once per turn, when you hit a creature with an attack that deals piercing damage, you can reroll one of the attack's damage dice, and you must use the new roll.

entries.name: Enhanced Critical.
entries: When you score a critical hit that deals piercing damage to a creature, you can roll one additional damage die when determining the extra piercing damage the target takes.

prerequisite.name: Pit Fighter
entries: You have trained to fight with weapons typically associated with gladiators, granting you the following benefits.

entries.name: Improvised or Specialized Weapons.
entries: You gain proficiency in one of the following:

items: Improvised Weapons
2 Specialized Weapons of your Choice

entries.name: Trident Wielder.
entries: For you, tridents deal 1d8 (1d10) piercing damage on a hit, instead of its usual 1d6 (1d8) piercing damage. Additionally, Tridents have the finesse property for you, as long as you are not wielding a shield or wearing heavy or medium armor.

entries.name: Net Thrower
entries: When you take the Attack action on your turn with a net, it only takes the place of one attack instead of using your entire action. Additionally, you do not have disadvantage on attack rolls when using your net on targets within 5 feet of you.

prerequisite.name: Planar Wanderer
entries: You can draw on the forces of the multiverse to survive cosmic extremes and to traverse its infinite realms, granting you these benefits:

items.name: Planar Adaptation
entries: When you finish a long rest, you gain resistance to either acid, cold, or fire damage (your choice) until you finish your next long rest.

items.name: Portal Cracker
entries: Your experience with portals allows you to open them without a portal key. As an action, you can concentrate on a portal you're aware of that is within 5 feet of yourself and make a {@dc 20} Intelligence ({@skill Arcana}) check. On a failed check, you take {@damage 3d8} psychic damage and can't use this benefit on that portal again until you finish a long rest. On a successful check, you can force the portal open or closed for 1 hour. For that duration, the portal doesn't respond to its portal key unless a creature employing the key succeeds on a {@dc 20} Intelligence ({@skill Arcana}) check as an action.

items.name: Portal Sense
entries: You know the direction to the last planar portal you used while you and the portal are on the same plane of existence. Moreover, as an action, you can detect the location of any portals within 30 feet of you that aren't behind {@quickref Cover||3||total cover}. Once you detect a portal with this action, you can't use the action again until you finish a long rest.

prerequisite.name: Poisoner
entries: You can prepare and deliver deadly poisons, granting you the following benefits.

entries.name: Proficiency and Advantage.
entries: You gain proficiency in {@item poisoner's kit|phb}. Additionally, whenever you make an ability check to detect or identify a poison, venom, or toxin, you have advantage on the roll.

entries.name: Brew Poisons.
entries: With one hour of work using a poisoner's kit and expending 50 gp worth of materials, you can create a number of doses of potent poison equal to your proficiency bonus. Once applied to a weapon or piece of ammunition, the poison retains its potency for 1 minute or until you hit with the weapon or ammunition. When a creature takes damage from the coated weapon or ammunition, that creature must succeed on a {@DC 14} Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 2d8} poison damage and become {@condition poisoned} until the end of your next turn.

entries.name: Potent Poison and Weapons.
entries: When you make a damage roll that deals Poison damage, it ignores Resistance to Poison damage. Additionally, you can apply poison to a weapon or piece of ammunition as a bonus action, instead of an action.

prerequisite.name: Polearm Master

prerequisite.other: Proficiency in at least 1 "Polearm Weapon" listed below
Proficiency in at least 1 "Polearm Weapon" listed below

entries: You can keep your enemies at bay with various polearm weapons, granting you the following benefits. For the purpose of this feat, the term \“Polearm Weapon\” refers to the following: {@item glaives}, {@item halberd}, {@item javelin}, {@item pike}, {@item quarterstaff}, and {@item spear}. Consult with your DM for a potential expanded list.

entries.name: Damage Boost.
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to damage rolls using polearm weapons.

entries.name: Finessed Reach.
entries: You treat all polearm weapons as if they have the Finesse and Reach Property, if they don’t already have one. Additionally, you can make an opportunity attack when someone enters your weapon’s reach, as long as you are wielding a polearm weapon.

entries.name: Dual Heads.
entries: Whenever you take the Attack action while wielding a Polearm Weapon, you can use your bonus action on that turn to make a melee attack with the opposite end of your weapon. On a hit, it deals bludgeoning damage equal to {@damage 1d4} + your ability modifier used for the attack roll.

prerequisite.name: Prodigy
entries: You have a knack for learning new things. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Bonus Proficiencies.
entries: You gain one {@table skills|phb|skill proficiency} of your choice, one {@filter tool proficiency|items|type=tool;artisan's tools} of your choice, and fluency in one language of your choice.

entries.name: Expertise.
entries: Choose one skill in which you have proficiency. You gain expertise with that skill, which means your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make with it. The skill you choose must be one that isn't already benefiting from a feature, such as Expertise, that doubles your proficiency bonus.

prerequisite.name: Quicksmithing
entries: You have mastered the art of on-the-fly invention, improvement, and jury-rigging. You can use your talents to create immediate, short-term magical effects similar to spells, given time and an adequate supply of aether.

When you choose this feat, you master two magical effects, each of which recreates the effect of a 1st-level spell that has the ritual tag. These spells can come from any class list, but Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for them.

If you come across a schematic geared toward quicksmithing or study with another quicksmith, you might be able to add another spell to the effects you have mastered. The spell's level can be no higher than half your level (rounded up), and it must have the ritual tag. The process of mastering the spell takes 2 hours per level of the spell, and costs 50 gp per level. The cost represents aether you use as you experiment with the spell effect to master it.

In addition, you have proficiency with {@item artisan's tools|PHB} (quicksmith's tools). Using those tools, you can spend 1 hour and 10 gp worth of materials to construct a Tiny clockwork device (AC 5, 1 hp). The device ceases to function after 24 hours unless you spend 1 hour repairing it to keep it functioning. You can use your action to dismantle the device, at which point you can reclaim the materials used to create it. You can have up to three such devices active at a time.
When you create a device, choose one of the following options:

entries.name: Clockwork Toy
entries: This toy is a clockwork animal, monster, or person, such as a frog, mouse, bird, dragon, or soldier. When placed on the ground, the toy moves 5 feet across the ground on each of your turns in a random direction. It makes noises as appropriate to the creature it represents.

entries.name: Fire Starter
entries: This device produces a miniature flame, which you can use to light a candle, torch, or campfire. Using the device requires your action.

entries.name: Music Box
entries: When opened, this music box plays a single song at a moderate volume. The box stops playing when it reaches the song's end or when it is closed.

prerequisite.name: Remarkable Recovery
entries: Your body has the ability to recover quickly from terrible injuries, and is unusually receptive to healing magic. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Bonus HP Stabilization.
entries: When you are successfully stabilized while dying, you regain hit points equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1).

entries.name: Bonus HP Regained.
entries: Whenever you regain hit points as a result of a spell, potion, or class feature (but not this feat), you regain additional hit points equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1).

prerequisite.name: Remarkable Recovery
entries: Your body has the ability to recover quickly from terrible injuries, and is unusually receptive to healing magic. You gain the following benefits:

items: When you are successfully stabilized while dying, you regain hit points equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1).
Whenever you regain hit points as a result of a spell, potion, or class feature (but not this feat), you regain additional hit points equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1).

prerequisite.name: Resilient

choose.entry: Increase the chosen ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

entries: Choose one ability score. You gain the following benefits:

entries.name: Saving Throw Proficiency
entries: You gain proficiency in saving throws using the chosen ability.

prerequisite.name: Revenant Blade
entries: You are descended from a master of the {@item double-bladed scimitar|ERLW}, and some of that mastery has passed on to you. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Armor Class Bonus.
entries: While you are holding a double-bladed scimitar with two hands, you gain a +1 bonus to Armor Class.

entries.name: Finesse Blade.
entries: A double-bladed scimitar has the finesse property when you wield it.

prerequisite.name: Revenant Blade
entries: You are descended from a master of the {@item double-bladed scimitar|ERLW}, and some of that mastery has passed on to you. You gain the following benefits:

items: While you are holding a double-bladed scimitar with two hands, you gain a +1 bonus to Armor Class.
A double-bladed scimitar has the finesse property when you wield it.

prerequisite.name: Righteous Heritor

feat: scion of the outer planes|sato|scion of the outer planes (good outer plane)

entries: You can channel cosmic forces of good to gain these benefits:

items.name: Soothe Pain
entries: When you or a creature within 30 feet of you takes damage, you can use your reaction to reduce that damage by {@dice 1d10} + your proficiency bonus. You can use this benefit a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

prerequisite.name: Ritual Caster
entries: You have learned a number of spells that you can cast as rituals. These spells are written in a ritual book, which you must have in hand when you cast them. You also gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Ritual Spells
entries: Choose a number of level 1 spells equal to your Proficiency Bonus that have the {@filter Ritual tag|spells|level=1|components & miscellaneous=ritual}. The spells' spellcasting ability is the ability increased by this feat.

entries.name: Gaining Additional Ritual Spells
entries: When your Proficiency Bonus increases, you can add an additional level 1 Ritual Spell to your Ritual Book. You can also add new Ritual Spells if you find a spellbook or a spell scroll with a level 1 ritual spell available. The process of copying the spell into your ritual book takes 2 hours per level of the spell, and costs 50 gp per level. The cost represents material components you expend as you experiment with the spell to master it, as well as the fine inks you need to record it.

entries.name: Spellcasters and Pact Magic.
entries: If you cast spells by expending spell slots, your Ritual Spells are always prepared for you, allowing you to cast them at higher levels using your available spell slots. Additionally, one of your selected spells with the Ritual Tag can be higher level than level 1, as long as you have the available spell slots, when you gain this Feat and when your Proficiency Bonus increases. The time and cost to record found ritual spells from your class list are halved.

prerequisite.name: Roguish Initiate
entries: You have spent time honing talents associated with the criminal underworld. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Language and Tool Proficiency.
entries: You learn to speak, read, write, and decode Thieves' Cant. You also gain proficiency with Thieves' Tools.

entries.name: Cunning Action.
entries: Choose one of the following actions: Dash, Dodge, Disengage, Hide, or Use an Object. You can use that Action as a Bonus Action.

entries.name: Repeatable.
entries: You can choose this Feat multiple times. Each time you do you must pick a different action from the Cunning Action benefit above, however you replace the Language and Tool Proficiency with gaining Expertise in 1 skill you already have proficiency with.

prerequisite.name: Rune Shaper
entries: You've studied the magic of Giant runes, granting you the following benefits.

entries.name: Comprehend Languages
entries: You learn the {@spell comprehend languages} spell. You can cast this spell without expending a spell slot, and you must finish a long rest before you can cast it in this way again. You can also cast this spell using any spell slots you have.

entries.name: Rune Magic
entries: You know a number of runes equal to half your proficiency bonus (rounded down), chosen from the Rune Spells table. Whenever you finish a long rest, you can inscribe each rune you know onto one nonmagical weapon, armor, piece of clothing, or other object you touch. You temporarily learn the 1st-level spells that correspond to the runes you inscribed, as specified on the Rune Spells table, and you know those spells until you finish a long rest, when the runes fade. While you are wearing or carrying any rune-marked object, you can cast the spells associated with those runes using any spell slots you have.

You can also invoke a rune inscribed on an object you are wearing or carrying and cast its associated spell without expending a spell slot or using material components.
