Once you cast the spell in this way, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest. Your spellcasting ability for this feat is Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma (choose when you select this feat).
Each time you gain a level, you can replace one of the runes you know with another one from the Rune Spells table.

prerequisite.name: Savage Attacker
entries: Your savage battle instincts let you exploit even the smallest weakness. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Brutal Critical.
entries: Whenever you score a critical hit with a melee weapon attack you roll the weapon's damage die three times instead of twice.

entries.name: Damage Reroll.
entries: Once per turn when you hit with a melee weapon attack, you can reroll the weapon’s damage dice, using either roll you choose.

prerequisite.name: Scion of the Outer Planes
entries: Your connection to an Outer Plane infuses you with the energy there. Choose a type of plane listed in the Planar Infusion table. Your choice gives you resistance to a damage type and the ability to cast a cantrip, as specified in the table. You can cast this cantrip without material components, and your spellcasting ability for it is Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma (choose when you select this feat).

prerequisite.name: Second Chance
entries: Fortune favors you when someone tries to strike you. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Reaction.
entries: When a creature you can see hits you with an attack roll, you can use your reaction to force that creature to reroll. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you roll initiative at the start of combat or until you finish a short or long rest.

prerequisite.name: Sentinel
entries: You have mastered techniques to take advantage of every drop in any enemy's guard, gaining the following benefits.

entries.name: Halt.
entries: When you hit a creature with an opportunity attack, the creature's speed becomes 0 for the rest of the turn.

entries.name: Ignoring Disengage.
entries: Creatures provoke opportunity attacks from you even if they take the {@action Disengage} action before leaving your reach.

entries.name: Guardian Reaction.
entries: When a creature within 5 feet of you makes an attack against a target other than you (and that target doesn't have this feat), you can use your reaction to make a melee weapon attack against the attacking creature.

prerequisite.name: Servo Crafting
entries: You are skilled in the creation of {@creature servo|psk|servos}—tiny constructs that function as personal assistants. You can cast the {@spell find familiar} spell as a ritual, creating a {@creature servo|psk} to serve as your familiar instead of an animal. A {@creature servo|psk}'s statistics appear in the "Artifact Creatures" section of this document. In every other way, a servo familiar functions as described in the {@spell find familiar} spell.
You can communicate telepathically with your servo familiar and perceive through its senses as long as you are on the same plane of existence. You can speak through your servo in your own voice.
Additionally, when you take the {@action Attack} action, you can forgo one of your own attacks to allow your servo familiar to make one attack of its own.

prerequisite.name: Shadow Touched
entries: Your exposure to the Shadowfell's magic has changed you, granting you the following benefits:

entries.name: Shadow Magic
entries: You learn the {@spell invisibility} spell and one {@filter 1st-level spell|spells|level=1|school=I;N} of your choice. The {@filter 1st-level spell|spells|level=1|school=I;N} must be from the illusion or necromancy school of magic. You can cast each of these spells without expending a spell slot. Once you cast either of these spells in this way, you can't cast that spell in this way again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast these spells using spell slots you have of the appropriate level. The spells' spellcasting ability is the ability increased by this feat or your own if you already have one.

prerequisite.name: Sharpshooter
entries: You have trained extensively with ranged weapons to become a master marksman. You gain the following benefits below.

entries.name: Long Range.
entries: Attacking at long range doesn't impose Disadvantage on your attack rolls with Ranged weapons.
If you have the Archery Fighting Style, being within 5 feet of a hostile creature does not impose disadvantage on your ranged attack rolls.

entries.name: Overcome Cover.
entries: Your attacks with ranged weapons ignore {@quickref Cover||3||half cover} and {@quickref Cover||3||three-quarters cover}.

entries.name: Steady Aim.
entries: You can use a bonus action to give yourself advantage on your next ranged weapon attack roll on your current turn. You can only do so if you have not used any of your movement speed and your speed becomes 0 for the rest of your turn once you do so.

prerequisite.name: Shield Master
entries: You use shields not just for protection but also for offense. You gain the following benefits while you are wielding a {@item shield|phb}.

entries.name: Shove.
entries: If you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn, you can use a bonus action to ake an Unarmed Shove Attack against a creature within 5 feet of you with your shield.

entries.name: DEX Saves.
entries: If you aren't {@condition incapacitated}, you can add your shield's AC bonus to any Dexterity saving throw you make against a spell or other harmful effect that targets only you.

entries.name: Shield-Vasion.
entries: If you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you can use your reaction to take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, interposing your shield between yourself and the source of the effect.

prerequisite.name: Skill Expert
entries: You have honed your proficiency with particular skills, granting you the following benefits.

entries.name: Skill Proficiency.
entries: You gain proficiency in one {@table skills|phb|skill} of your choice.

entries.name: Expertise.
entries: Choose one skill in which you have proficiency. You gain expertise with that skill, which means your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make with it. The skill you choose must be one that isn't already benefiting from a feature, such as Expertise, that doubles your proficiency bonus.

prerequisite.name: Skilled
entries: You gain proficiency in any combination of three {@table skills|phb} or {@filter tools|items|type=tools;artisan's tools;instrument;gaming set;vehicle (land);vehicle (water)} of your choice.

prerequisite.name: Skulker
entries: You are an expert at slinking through shadows and staying hidden. You gain the benefits listed below.

entries.name: Hide.
entries: When you are lightly obscured, you can take the {@action Hide} action as a bonus action on your turn. If you are hidden from a creature and miss with a ranged attack, you don't reveal your position.

entries.name: Darkvision.
entries: You gain Darkvision to a range of 60 feet. If you already have Darkvision, your range increases by 30ft.

prerequisite.name: Slasher
entries: You've learned where to cut to have the greatest results, granting you the following benefits.

entries.name: Hamstring.
entries: Once per turn when you hit a creature with an attack that deals slashing damage, you can reduce the speed of the target by 10 feet until the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Enhanced Critical.
entries: When you score a critical hit that deals slashing damage to a creature, you grievously wound it. Until the start of your next turn, the target has disadvantage on all attack rolls.

prerequisite.name: Soul of the Storm Giant

feat: strike of the giants|BGG|strike of the giants (storm strike)

entries: You've manifested the tempest magic emblematic of storm giants, granting you the following benefits:

items.name: Maelstrom Aura
entries: As a bonus action, you surround yourself with an aura of magical wind and lightning that extends 10 feet from you in every direction but not through {@quickref Cover||3||total cover}. The aura lasts until the start of your next turn or until you are incapacitated. While the aura is active, you have resistance to lightning and thunder damage. In addition, attack rolls against you have disadvantage, and whenever another creature starts its turn within the aura, you can force the creature to make a Strength saving throw (DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + the modifier of the ability increased by this feat). On a failed save, the creature's speed is halved until the start of its next turn. You can use this bonus action a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

prerequisite.name: Specialized Training
entries: You have practiced extensively with unique weapons, uncommon in these lands. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Specialized Weapon Training.
entries: You gain proficiency in 4 Specialized Weapons of your choice.

entries.name: Preferred Specialty.
entries: Choose one of your specialized weapons to be your preferred weapon. You always know that weapon’s mastery property. It does not count against your known mastery properties if you have the weapon mastery class feature.

prerequisite.name: Spell Sniper
entries: You have learned techniques to enhance your attacks with certain kinds of spells, gaining the following benefits:

entries.name: Increased and Decreased Range.
entries: When you cast a spell that requires you to make an attack roll and has a range of at least 10 feet, the spell's range is doubled. Additionally, casting a spell with a ranged spell attack roll on a target within 5 feet of you does not impose disadvantage.

entries.name: Bypass Cover
entries: Your attack rolls for spells ignore {@quickref Cover||3||half cover} and {@quickref Cover||3||three-quarters cover}.

entries.name: Bonus cantrip.
entries: You learn one {@filter cantrip|spells|level=0|spell attack=m;r;o} that requires an attack roll from any class list. Your spellcasting ability for this cantrip is the one increased by this feat.

prerequisite.name: Spelldriver
entries: Through intense focus, training, and dedication, you've harnessed the techniques of rapid spellcasting, gaining the following benefits.

entries.name: Dual-Leveled Casting
entries: When you use your bonus action to cast a spell of 1st level or higher, you can also use your action to cast another spell of 1st level or higher. However, if you cast two or more spells in a single turn, only one of them can be 3rd level or higher.

entries.name: Rules Tip: Casting Multiple Spells
entries: Normally, when you cast a spell as a bonus action, you can't use your action to also cast a spell that turn unless that spell is a cantrip—{@note see {@book PHB p202|PHB|10|Bonus Action}.} The Spelldriver feat removes that restriction, but the focus necessary to channel multiple spells in the same round still limits the overall power of those spells.

prerequisite.name: Spelldriver
entries: Through intense focus, training, and dedication, you've harnessed the techniques of rapid spellcasting.

When you use your bonus action to cast a spell of 1st level or higher, you can also use your action to cast another spell of 1st level or higher. However, if you cast two or more spells in a single turn, only one of them can be 3rd level or higher.

entries.name: Rules Tip: Casting Multiple Spells
entries: Normally, when you cast a spell as a bonus action, you can't use your action to also cast a spell that turn unless that spell is a cantrip—{@note see {@book PHB p202|PHB|10|Bonus Action}.} The Spelldriver feat removes that restriction, but the focus necessary to channel multiple spells in the same round still limits the overall power of those spells.

prerequisite.name: Spellsword Adept
entries: You have trained to combine your minor magics with weapon attacks, gaining the following benefits.

entries.name: Bonus Cantrips.
entries: You learn two Cantrips of your choice from any class list, choosing Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma as your spellcasting ability. Both Cantrips must meet the following criteria:

items: Must deal damage with a Spell Attack roll
Duration is Instantaneous or 1 Round
Targets only 1 creature

entries.name: Magical Weapons.
entries: On your turn, you can use a Bonus Action to imbue 1 of the cantrips gained through this feat onto your weapon of choice, placing Ranged Spell Attacks on Ranged Weapons, or Melee Spell Attacks on Melee Weapons. The magical effect lasts on the weapon until the end of your current turn or on your next hit, whichever happens first. You can use either your standard weapon ability or your chosen spellcasting ability for your attack and damage roll. On a hit, you deal the spell’s damage and its effects with a bonus +1 to the damage roll.

items.name: Limitations.
entries: You do not gain the Cantrip Upgrade benefits when you deal damage.

prerequisite.name: Squat Nimbleness
entries: You are uncommonly nimble for your race. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Movement Speed Bonus.
entries: Increase your walking speed by 5 feet.

entries.name: Skill Proficiency.
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Acrobatics} or {@skill Athletics} skill (your choice).

entries.name: Advantage against Grappled.
entries: You have advantage on any Strength ({@skill Athletics}) or Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) check you make to escape from being {@condition grappled}.

prerequisite.name: Squire of Solamnia
entries: Your training in the ways of the Knights of Solamnia grants you these benefits:

items.name: Mount Up
entries: Mounting or dismounting costs you only 5 feet of movement.

items.name: Precise Strike
entries: Once per turn, when you make a weapon attack roll against a creature, you can cause the attack roll to have advantage. If the attack hits, you roll a {@dice d8} and add the number rolled as a bonus to the attack's damage roll. You can use this benefit a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, but a use is expended only if the attack hits. You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Membership in Knightly Orders
entries: Knights of Solamnia are only ever members of one of their organization's orders. In the course of their training, most knights begin as members of the Knights of the Crown and then move on to join other orders. Whether a character follows this path or another, they retain what they learned as a member of an order even if they join another. Characters can change what knightly order they're a part of, but they always have access to any Knight of Solamnia feats they've acquired.

prerequisite.name: Strike of the Giants
entries: You have absorbed primeval magic that gives you an echo of the might of giants. When you take this feat, choose one of the benefits listed below. Once per turn, when you hit a target with a melee weapon attack or a ranged weapon attack using a thrown weapon, you can imbue the attack with an additional effect depending on the benefit you chose.

entries.name: Cloud Strike
entries: The target takes an extra {@damage 1d4} thunder damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw, or you become invisible to it until the start of your next turn or until immediately after you make an attack roll or cast a spell.

entries.name: Fire Strike
entries: The target takes an extra {@damage 1d10} fire damage.

entries.name: Frost Strike
entries: The target takes an extra {@damage 1d6} cold damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Constitution saving throw, or its speed is reduced to 0 until the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Hill Strike
entries: The target takes an extra {@damage 1d6} damage of the weapon's type. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Strength saving throw or have the prone condition.

entries.name: Stone Strike
entries: The target takes an extra {@damage 1d6} force damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pushed 10 feet from you in a straight line.

entries.name: Storm Strike
entries: The target takes an extra {@damage 1d6} lightning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Constitution saving throw, or it has disadvantage on attack rolls until the start of your next turn.
The saving throw DC for these effects equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength or Constitution modifier.
You can use this feat a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

prerequisite.name: Strixhaven Initiate
entries: You have studied some magical theory and have learned a few spells associated with Strixhaven University.

Choose one of Strixhaven's colleges: Lorehold, Prismari, Quandrix, Silverquill, or Witherbloom. You learn two cantrips and one 1st-level spell based on the college you choose, as specified in the Strixhaven Spells table.
You can cast the chosen 1st-level spell without a spell slot, and you must finish a long rest before you can cast it in this way again. You can also cast the spell using any spell slots you have.
Your spellcasting ability for this feat's spells is Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma (choose when you select this feat).

entries.caption: Strixhaven Spells
rows: Choose two from {@spell light}, {@spell sacred flame}, and {@spell thaumaturgy}.
Choose two from {@spell fire bolt}, {@spell prestidigitation}, and {@spell ray of frost}.
Choose two from {@spell druidcraft}, {@spell guidance}, and {@spell mage hand}.
Choose one 1st-level {@filter druid or wizard spell|spells|level=1|class=druid;wizard}.
Choose two from {@spell sacred flame}, {@spell thaumaturgy}, and {@spell vicious mockery}.
Choose one 1st-level {@filter bard or cleric spell|spells|level=1|class=bard;cleric}.
Choose two from {@spell chill touch}, {@spell druidcraft}, and {@spell spare the dying}.
Choose one 1st-level {@filter druid or wizard spell|spells|level=1|class=druid;wizard}.

prerequisite.name: Strixhaven Mascot
entries: You have learned how to summon a Strixhaven mascot to assist you, granting you these benefits:

items: You can cast the {@spell find familiar} spell as a ritual. Your familiar can take the form of the mascot associated with the college you chose for the Strixhaven Initiate feat: a {@creature spirit statue mascot|scc} (Lorehold), an {@creature art elemental mascot|scc} (Prismari), a {@creature fractal mascot|scc} (Quandrix), an {@creature inkling mascot|scc} (Silverquill), or a {@creature pest mascot|scc} (Witherbloom).
When you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn, you can forgo one attack to allow your mascot familiar to make one attack of its own with its reaction.

If your mascot familiar is within 60 feet of you, you can teleport as an action, swapping places with the familiar. If your destination space is too small for you to occupy, the teleportation fails and is wasted. Once you teleport in this way, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest, unless you expend a spell slot of 2nd level or higher to do it again.

prerequisite.name: Survivalist Training
entries: You have been trained to survive, track, and explore in the wild, much like a Ranger. You gain the benefits.

entries.name: Gained Knack.
entries: You learn one Knack of your choice from those available to the Ranger class. If the Knack requires you to roll a Quarry Die, you roll a {@dice d4} unless you already have a Quarry Die from another source. If the Knack forces a saving throw, the DC is equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier.
If the Knack has a listed level prerequisite, you are unable to gain it with this feat as the levels relate to your Ranger level.

prerequisite.name: Svirfneblin Magic
entries: You have inherited the innate spellcasting ability of your ancestors, granting you the following benefits.

entries.name: Additional Spells
entries: You can cast {@spell nondetection} on yourself at will, without needing a material component. You can also cast each of the following spells once per long rest at its lowest level: {@spell blindness/deafness}, {@spell blur}, and {@spell disguise self}. Your spellcasting ability is the one you use to cast your other Deep Gnome spells.

prerequisite.name: Svirfneblin Magic
entries: You have inherited the innate spellcasting ability of your ancestors. This ability allows you to cast {@spell nondetection} on yourself at will, without needing a material component. You can also cast each of the following spells once with this ability: {@spell blindness/deafness}, {@spell blur}, and {@spell disguise self}. You regain the ability to cast these spells when you finish a long rest.
Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for these spells, and you cast them at their lowest possible levels.

prerequisite.name: Tavern Brawler
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Enhanced Unarmed Strike
entries: When you hit with your Unarmed Strike Attack, you gain a bonus to your damage roll equal to half of your proficiency bonus, round down.

entries.name: Damage Rerolls
entries: Whenever you roll a damage die for your Unarmed Strike Attack, you can reroll the die if it rolls a 1, and you must use the new roll.

entries.name: Punch and Push
entries: When you hit a creature with an Unarmed Strike Attack as part of the {@action Attack|PHB} action on your turn, you can deal damage to the target and also push it 5 feet away from you. You can use this benefit only once per turn.

entries.name: Improvised Weaponry
entries: You have proficiency with improvised weapons, treating objects as if they have the Finesse Weapon property. Once per turn, when you hit with an improvised weapon attack, you can choose to destroy the object, rendering it useless for future attacks, but dealing the maximum possible damage, instead of rolling.

Additionally, on your turn, you can use your Free Object Interaction to grab up to two objects to use as weapons as long as you have free hands available. You do not gain this benefit if you already used your Free Object Interaction for something else, including stowing your standard weapons.

feat.name: Telekinetic
entries: You learn to move things with your mind, granting you the following benefits.

entries.name: Minor Telekinesis.
entries: You learn the {@spell mage hand} cantrip. You can cast it without verbal or somatic components, and you can make the spectral hand {@condition invisible}. If you already know this spell, its range increases by 30 feet when you cast it. Its spellcasting ability is the ability increased by this feat.

entries.name: Telekinetic Shove.
entries: As a bonus action, you can try to telekinetically shove one creature you can see within 30 feet of you. When you do so, the target must succeed on a Strength saving throw ({@dc 8} + your proficiency bonus + the ability modifier of the score increased by this feat) or be moved 5 feet toward you or away from you. A creature can willingly fail this save.

feat.name: Telepathic
entries: You awaken the ability to mentally connect with others, granting you the following benefits.

entries.name: Telepathic Utterance.
entries: You can speak telepathically to any creature you can see within 60 feet of you. Your telepathic utterances are in a language you know, and the creature understands you only if it knows that language. Your communication doesn't give the creature the ability to respond to you telepathically.

entries.name: Detect Thoughts.
entries: You can cast the {@spell detect thoughts} spell, requiring no spell slot or components, and you must finish a long rest before you can cast it this way again. Your spellcasting ability for the spell is the ability increased by this feat. If you have spell slots of 2nd level or higher, you can cast this spell with them.

feat.name: Thrown Arms Master
entries: You've honed your ability to lob weaponry into the fray, including weapons not meant for ranged combat. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: All Weapons are Thrown Weapons.
entries: Simple and martial melee weapons without the thrown property have the thrown property for you. One-handed weapons have a normal range of 20 feet and a long range of 60 feet, while two-handed weapons have a normal range of 15 feet and a long range of 30 feet.
Weapons that already have the thrown property increase their short range by 20 feet and their long range by 40 feet for you.
If you have the {@optionalfeatures Hurler} Fighting Style, melee weapons that do not come with the thrown weapon property gain a 10 feet bonus to the above listed ranges.

entries.name: Boomerang.
entries: When you miss with a thrown weapon attack using a light weapon, the weapon returns to your grasp like a boomerang at the end of your turn, unless something prevents it from returning. You can catch and stow as many weapons as you threw in this way.

feat.name: Thrown Arms Master
entries: You've honed your ability to lob weaponry into the fray, including weapons not meant for ranged combat. You gain the following benefits:

items: Simple and martial melee weapons without the thrown property have the thrown property for you. One-handed weapons have a normal range of 20 feet and a long range of 60 feet, while two-handed weapons have a normal range of 15 feet and a long range of 30 feet.
Weapons that already have the thrown property increase their short range by 20 feet and their long range by 40 feet for you.

When you miss with a thrown weapon attack using a light weapon, the weapon returns to your grasp like a boomerang at the end of your turn, unless something prevents it from returning. You can catch and stow as many weapons as you threw in this way.

feat.name: Tough
entries: You have the ability to push yourself in difficult situations to last longer than most. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Consistent Hit Point Increase.
entries: You gain a bonus to your Hit Point Maximum equal to two times your player level when you gained this feat. Whenever you gain a level thereafter, your hit point maximum increases by an additional 2 hit points.

feat.name: Two-Weapon Adept
entries: You have trained extensively to effectively fight wielding two melee weapons at once. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Armor Class Bonus.
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to your Armor Class while you are wielding one melee weapon per hand.

entries.name: Dual Wielding.
entries: You can engage in the {@action Two-Weapon Fighting} Action while wielding any one-handed non-Heavy weapon in your main hand and a Light Weapon in your off-hand.

entries.name: Weapons Stow.
entries: You can draw or stow two one-handed weapons when you would normally be able to draw or stow only one.

entries.name: Opportunity Attacks.
entries: If you have the Dual Wielder Fighting Style, you can make two attacks, one with each hand, when making an opportunity attack.

feat.name: Vampiric Exultation
entries: As an action, you can transform the lower half of your body into an inky black vapor, allowing you to float through the air. While transformed, you have a flying speed of 30 feet. You can maintain this form for up to 10 minutes. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

feat.name: Vigor of the Hill Giant

feat: strike of the giants|BGG|strike of the giants (hill strike)

entries: You've manifested the resilience emblematic of hill giants, granting you the following benefits:

items.name: Bulwark
entries: When you are subjected to an effect that would move you at least 5 feet or give you the prone condition, you can use your reaction to steady yourself. You aren't moved and don't have the prone condition.

items.name: Iron Stomach
entries: Whenever you eat food as part of a short rest and spend one or more Hit Dice to regain hit points, you regain additional hit points equal to your Constitution modifier + your proficiency bonus.

feat.name: Vital Sacrifice
entries: You've learned secrets of {@variantrule hemocraft|TDCSR} that grant you esoteric power at the price of your own life force. As a bonus action, you can choose to take {@damage 1d6} necrotic damage to gain a blood boon. Your blood boon lasts for 1 hour or until expended.
You can expend this blood boon to gain one of the following benefits:

items: When you make an attack roll, you roll {@dice 1d6} and add it to the total.
When you hit with an attack or spell, you deal an additional {@damage 2d6} necrotic damage.
When you cause a creature to make a Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution {@quickref saving throws|PHB|2|1|saving throw}, roll a {@dice d4} and reduce their save by the amount rolled.

entries: The damage you take to gain a blood boon can't be reduced in any way.

feat.name: War Caster
entries: You have practiced casting spells in the midst of combat, learning techniques that grant you the following benefits.

entries.name: Maintaining Concentration.
entries: You have Advantage on Constitution saving throws that you make to maintain {@status concentration}. If neither roll makes the save, you can use your reaction to add your spell attack bonus to the highest roll in an attempt to maintain {@status concentration}.

entries.name: Somatic Components.
entries: You can perform the somatic components of spells even when you have weapons or a shield in one or both hands.

entries.name: Reactive Casting.
entries: When you make an {@action Opportunity Attack|PHB}, you can cast a spell instead. It must have a casting time of 1 Action or 1 Attack and this spell can only target that creature. Your reach does not change for this {@action Opportunity Attack|PHB}. If a spell has a casting time of Special: On Hit, it does not qualify for this benefit.

feat.name: Weapon Adept
entries: You have spent many hours honing your skills with the deadly armaments of war. You gain the benefits listed below:

entries.name: Gaining Additional Weapon Proficiencies.
entries: You gain proficiency with four weapons of your choice. Each one must be a simple or a martial weapon.
When you gain this feat, if you already have proficiency in at least 8 simple weapons, you can instead choose to gain proficiency in all simple weapons.

entries.name: Attack or Damage Bonus.
entries: Choose 1 weapon that you already have proficiency in. This weapon gains a +1 bonus to either your attack or damage roll.

entries.name: Repeatable.
entries: You can choose this feat again at higher levels.

feat.name: Weapon Master
entries: You have practiced extensively with certain weapons, learning how to wield it in a way that others can’t. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Access to Mastery Property.
entries: Your training with weapons allows you to use the mastery property of one kind of Simple or Martial weapon of your choice, provided you have proficiency with it. Whenever you finish a Long Rest, you can change the kind of weapon to another eligible kind. If you already have access to weapon mastery as a class feature, this does not count towards your known mastery weapons.

entries.name: Attack AND Damage Bonus.
entries: Choose 1 weapon that you have. This weapon gains a +1 bonus to your attack and damage rolls. When your proficiency bonus increases, you can choose an additional weapon to gain this benefit.

feat.name: Wild Companion
entries: You have forged a bond with an animal companion that will adventure by your side, granting you the following benefits.

entries.name: Your Wild Companion.
entries: Choose a {@filter Medium or smaller beast of CR 1/8 or lower|bestiary|Challenge Rating=[&0;&1/8]|type=beast|size=&tiny;&Medium} to be your Wild Companion. This Companion is friendly to you, and it obeys your commands to the best of its abilities.

Your Companion uses its normal stat block, and it learns to understand one language of your choice that you already speak at the time you take this feat. You and your Companion can communicate simple ideas to each other using a series of clicks, whistles, and gestures. It gains all the normal benefits of both short and long rests.

entries.name: Combat Commands.
entries: In combat, your Wild Companion acts during your turn. It can move and use its reaction on its own, but it will only take the Dodge action on its turn unless you use a bonus action to command it to take an action. If you have proficiency in Animal Handling, it takes no action to command your companion. If you are incapacitated, your Companion will defend you to the best of its ability.

If your Companion dies, you can spend 8 hours tracking a suitable beast of CR 1/8 or lower in your immediate vicinity to take on as your new Wild Companion. If you are unable to locate a Companion after 8 hours of searching, you may try again after a long rest.

entries.name: Leveling Up your Companion.
entries: On subsequent level advancements, your Companion gains additional HP equal to the average (or roll) of the creature’s hit die, as noted in parenthesis to the right of the “Hit Points” section of their stat block, along with one additional hit die. Ability Score Increases you attain after finding your companion are also gained by your companion.

entries.name: Variant Wild Copanions.
entries: You may alternatively select a Wild Familiar or a Wild Mount, provided it follows the respective prerequisites:

items.name: Wild Familiar.
entries: The size of your Wild Familiar is Tiny and cannot be any larger.

items.name: Wild Mount.
entries: The size of your Wild Mount can be Large. It is recommended that your Mount is one size larger than you. If you choose a Mount that is your size, they cannot take the Dash Action while you are mounted. Additionally, you follow the rules on Mounted Combat.
